dcterms:creator: D. Cohen
Y. C. Eldar
A. M. Haimovich
dcterms:description: SUMMeR is a radar system that employs a thinned colocated MIMO array to recover targets' ranges, velocities, and directions by collecting low-rate samples at each receiver element.
dcterms:title: SUMMeR

dcterms:creator: Y. C. Eldar
dcterms:description: The FRI model is utilized for recovering target delays in sub-Nyquist radar systems, allowing for signal detection and parameter estimation from fewer measurements.
dcterms:title: FRI model

dcterms:creator: Y. C. Eldar
dcterms:description: Xampling is a framework that allows for low-rate sampling of signals, which is essential for sub-Nyquist radar systems to obtain samples efficiently.
dcterms:title: Xampling

dcterms:creator: J. Ying
H. Lu
Q. Wei
J. F. Cai
D. Guo
J. Wu
Z. Chen
X. Qu
dcterms:description: HMRTC is a method for tensor completion that utilizes Hankel matrix nuclear norm regularization to recover n-dimensional exponential signals.
dcterms:title: HMRTC
